results.title: Escape from the sea
results.creator_credit: Peter Seabourne, A. Frank Bundy and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: A film designed for a youthful audience depicting the adventures of a boy about 12 years old who gets into difficulty in the sea in his rubber dingy. He is rescued by a scouting group who then have problems when their leader is hit by falling rocks. He in turn is rescued by helicopter. Filmed on the foreshores of Cornwall this is a “safety” film showing the work of the Royal Naval Rescue Service and HM Coastguard.

results.title: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius
results.brief_description: Graphic footage of the eruption of Mt Vesuvius in 1946 (?). Particularly spectacular form the stress level footage of collapsing houses etc, in surrounding villages.

results.title: Ergonomics: the practical approach
results.brief_description: Ergonomics is the study of the relationship between people, the equipment they use, and the physical environment in which they work. Ergonomics is a continuous process which aims to improve productivity and health through practical measures which reduce difficult situations. This program and guide looks at how ergonomics is applied, static and dynamic muscular effort, visual controls and displays, as well as a follow up questionnaire.

results.title: Equilibrium: the limit of disorder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Defines equilibrium as a state of balance between the conflicting requirements for minimum internal energy and maximum entropy of a system and shows that free energy is at a minimum in the condition of equilibrium. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Equal to the task
results.brief_description: This film show many of the tasks carried out by the Royal Australian Army Service Corps, including transportation, handling and supply of rations, in despatch of supplies, supply of petrol by most modern methods and training of army cooks.

results.title: Epilepsy: assessment and management
results.brief_description: Video footage of a 2001 satellite broadcast to country doctors through the Rural Health satellite network and “The Health Channel” which was also streamed on the web. A panel of experts comprising epileptologists, a clinical pharmacologist and a general practitioner discuss epilepsy, a common, misunderstood, misdiagnosed and often unrecognised condition affecting between 1-2% of the population. Emphasis is placed on treating individuals on a case by case basis and the importance of tailoring treatment to the individual. Myths surrounding the disease are explored, facts and figures provided, definitions, types of seizures, diagnosis, treatment, resources and an interview with Tony Grieg, diagnosed with epilepsy age 12. Also features 2 case studies. Norman Swan hosts the panel.

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance

results.title: Entombed warriors
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the partially excavated ‘Terracotta Army’ found at Xian in China. Explores the excavation techniques and the historical significance of the find.

results.title: Enterprise in steam
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Brian Bosisto and Bosisto Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Pichi Pichi Railway Preservation Society and their efforts in re-opening 32 kilometres of historical railway track at Quorn in South Australia’s northern region. Apart from showing the restoration of steam locomotive carriages and bridges the film shows the spirit of enterprise in a community
